Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can show a drawing of a plant with plenty of water and a plant without water, with clear differences visible.
The student can illustrate how a plant looks healthy with water, such as green leaves and an upright stance.
The student can illustrate how a plant looks unhealthy without water, such as with brown leaves and wilting.
The student can make basic observations of plant changes over time with and without water, potentially showing multiple stages or time points.
The student can identify and draw some patterns like differences in plant growth with water and without water.
CANNOT: The student might not fully detail more subtle observations of plant changes over time, focusing more on obvious changes.

The student might struggle to fully use their drawing to explain why water is important for plant life, possibly omitting details or reasons (e.g., may show differences but not explain them in detail).
